name: bj-vtoclg1fv
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, c1), w0, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), w0)
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
-| wi(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), w0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), w0)
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
-| wi(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), w0)
-| wi(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), w0)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), w0)
-| wnf(s0, w0)
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w0))
-| w1

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), w0)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c1)
-| wnf(s0, w0)
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w0))
-| w1

comment: Version of ~ bj-vtoclg1f with a disjoint variable condition on ` x , V ` . This removes dependency on ~ df-sb and ~ df-clab . Prefer its use over ~ bj-vtoclg1f when sufficient (in particular when ` V ` is substituted for ` _V ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 14-Sep-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
